{"step_by_step_thinking": "Limbal epithelial stem cells are a specific type of stem cell found in the eye. They are not marked by common proteins like elastin, keratin, or collagen, which are more associated with structural functions in various tissues. Instead, these stem cells are often identified by specific markers that are associated with stem cell properties. ABCG2 is a well-known stem cell marker, including for limbal epithelial stem cells.", "answer_choice": "D"}
